answers.answer: Hi!I can understand your concerns. Is she overweight? If yes, then shedding some weight may help. Other than this it can be a nerve compression. The other possibilities she may have been tested for: low vitamin B12, low vitamin D, diabetes, hypothyroidism, rheumatoid arthritis, lupus and anemia. Take care!The medical advice given should not be considered a substitute for medical care provided by a doctor who can examine you. The advice may not be completely correct for you as the doctor cannot examine you and does not know your complete medical history. Hence this reply to your post should only be considered as a guiding line and you must consult your doctor at the earliest for your medical problem.

question: My daughter has been complaining about her hands/fingers hurting for some time. I had blood work done and everything came back normal. I thought that might appease her and make it better but it didn't. She is still complaining. I've tried icing them, having her wear gloves, take aspirin and Motrin. She doesn't do anything that should be make her fingers hurt. She doesn't use the computer or text on the phone (believe it or not). Any ideas? I'm stumped!
title: 16 year old has finger pain
